task_summary: Pick up white plate and place it on red plate using robotic arm

task_long_description.overview: The task involves a robotic arm manipulating two plates in a laboratory environment. The robot must detect and grasp a white circular plate, then precisely place it onto a red circular plate. The workspace contains a green surface with both plates initially separated. The task requires careful object detection, grasp planning, and placement control to avoid damaging the plates or missing the target location.
preconditions: Both white and red plates are visible and accessible
Robot arm is in safe starting position
Gripper is operational and properly calibrated
stepwise_plan: Plan grasp approach for white plate
Move to white plate and align gripper
Execute pick operation on white plate
Move above red plate with clearance
Plan placement pose relative to red plate
Lower and place white plate onto red plate
success_criteria: White plate is successfully grasped without slipping
White plate is placed stably on red plate
Plates are aligned concentrically or acceptably overlapped
No collision or damage occurs during manipulation
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, retry scan with different camera angles
If grasp fails, retry with adjusted gripper pose
If placement misses target, retry with refined pose computation
task_long_description.termination: Task completes when white plate is stably placed on red plate and robot retreats to safe position

frame_2.now_evidence: Robot arm positioned directly above white plate in optimal grasp configuration
frame_2.predicts_next: Gripper closure and pick operation expected

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Detect and locate target object in scene
Calculate optimal grasp pose for target object
Move gripper to approach position with specified tolerance
Execute pick operation using computed grasp pose
Move to position above target with specified vertical offset
Place object at computed pose with specified force and orientation
Move gripper away from current position by specified distance

recovery_strategy: Retry object detection with different viewpoints
Recompute grasp pose with alternative strategy
assumptions: Plates are rigid and won't deform under manipulation
Workspace lighting is adequate for vision system
No external disturbances during task execution

expected_success_criteria: Final configuration shows white plate centered on red plate
